Name: Der Mantel
Notes: Opera composed on the short story 'The Cloak' by Nikolai Gogol, published in 1842. A consistent theme in the work of the composer is to expose hierarchies by grotesque and absurd situations.
Long Description: Der Mantel is an opera in 2 acts based on the story by Nikolai Gogol. It explores themes of social hierarchy and the absurdity of societal structures through the story of Akakij Akakiewitsch, a lowly clerk who dreams of social acceptance through the acquisition of a new coat. After his coat is stolen, he dies and haunts St. Petersburg, raising questions about identity and social justice.
Short Description: An opera based on Nikolai Gogol's 'The Cloak', exploring social hierarchies and the absurdity of societal structures.
